info.name: Ringba API Documentation
info.description:
Ringbaâ€™s APIs allow you to interact, gather information, and make dynamic changes in real-time. All functions found within the Ringba portal are also available programmatically through our API. 

If this is your first time using our API, please read the __Getting Started__ section below.

item.name: Getting Started
item.description:
Every API request requires an authentication token. For this, there are two options:

* Bearer Token, lasts 60 mins
* API Token, never expires and admins can delete at any time

We recommend that a user makes all API calls using an API Token which can be found by following these steps:

1. Create an account with Ringba, which can be done at [Ringba.com](http://www.ringba.com/pricing/)
2. Once the account is created, log in to the UI. From the dashboard open the menu, click "Security", click "API Access Tokens", then click the "Add API Access Token" button. Enter a name for the token then click "Add". A window will appear containing the newly created API Token. Save this token somewhere secure because __you will not be able to view this token again once you close the pop up window__.
3. Use this token for any future API requests. In the examples throughout this documentation, the API Token you just created will replace `{apiToken}` in the header `Authorization: Token {apiToken}`.

If you do not have a way to access the UI, a Bearer Token can be created by following the instructions in the [Bearer Tokens](#how-to-generate-and-utilize-your-bearer-token) section of this documentation. Once the Bearer Token has been created it can be used to create a new API Token using the [Create API Token](#how-to-generate-your-api-token) section. If an API Token is created through this request __it will only be displayed once__ so save it in a secure location.


Here are a few things to keep in mind when using Ringba's API:
* Bearer tokens expire after 60 mins. (Must be pulled via API)
* API tokens will not expire and __will only be shown once__. (Can be pulled on the UI)
* Authorization Header with "Bearer" for Bearer tokens. 
* Authorization Header with "Token" for API tokens.
* There are 3 user roles: Admin, Publisher, and Buyer. Not all endpoints are available for every role, and a 403 response means your current role does not have permission to access that endpoint.
* Throughout this documentation, anywhere that you see something surrounded by {} means it is a variable and the braces do not need to be included. So if you see \{accountId} simply replace that with your account ID without any curly braces.
* Throughout this documentation, all request bodies are sent in a JSON format, which is the recommended format to ensure successful requests.

item.description:
## How to generate and utilize your Bearer Token

To get your token, make a POST request to `https://{{url}}/token` with your user credentials in the body (in urlencoded format). When performed successfully you will get a response containing a token like the following:

```
"access_token": "f0093At900LqRTnpeLMgev9V...xjeN##########"
```

You will need this token in order to get or create an API Token. The authentication header to make subsequent requests will be:

```
Authorization: Bearer {{accessToken}}
```

So for the example above it would translate to the following:

```
Authorization: Bearer f0093At900LqRTnpeLMgev9V...xjeN##########
```

item.name: API Tokens

request.description:
Endpoint to retrieve a list of IDs of current API Tokens in your account. ### Response Overview

If the API Token has not been used, the `usage` array will be empty, otherwise it will contain the last 10 actions. This request will __NOT__ return the actual API Token, but will show the ID of each Token. If you need the actual API Token, you can create a new one using the `POST Create API Token` request or contact Ringba support.

response.name: Get API Tokens with usage
Get API Tokens

request.description:
#### How to Generate Your API Token

Create an API Token to be used for authenticating requests indefinitely. In the json response grab the `token` value and use as `{apiToken}` in the header `Authorization: Token {apiToken}` on all other requests. The body must contain the name for your API Token so you can identify when pulling the list of active tokens.

**NOTE: The API Token will be shown only once, please keep it in a safe place**

response.name: Create Api Token

request.description: Delete any existing API Token by supplying the ID in the URL. The IDs can be retrieved using the "Get API Tokens" endpoint.

response.name: Delete Api Token

item.description:
## Get or Create API Token

In addition to our user authentication tokens, you can also use API Tokens whenever you want to avoid saving credentials in your apps for Ringba API consumption. API Tokens do not have an expiration date and can only be created and deleted by Admin accounts. It is important to note that the token will only be shown once, so it must be kept in a safe location at all times. Ringba staff cannot retrieve a lost API Token and it would need to be replaced if lost.

Whenever an API Token is to be used, the Authorization header must include the word "Token" followed by the token string like the following. 

```
Authorization:	Token {{apitoken}}
```

request.description: Simple authenticated request that uses the `API Token`. This request pulls the account information of the user that was granted the API Token. You can use this request if you ever need to find out your `Account ID` for other API requests.

request.description:
Create a new address to associate with this account. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name you want to assign to this address to make it easier to identify later
countryName The country this address is in
countryCode The alphabetic country code for the country of the address
customerName The name of the business associated with this address
streetAddress The street address you want to add
city The city the address is in
postalCode The postal (zip) code for the address
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
region The state or region for the address, if applicable

item.name: Call Adjustments
Adjust Revenue and/or Payment for a Call (with relative adjustments)

body.raw:
{
    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": true,
    "adjustConverionByAmount": -0.01,
    "adjustPayoutByAmount": 0.01
}

request.description:
This request can adjust the `revenue` received from a buyer for a call as well as the `payout` amount paid to a publisher for a call. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
reason The reason that the adjustment is being made
adjustConversion Boolean value to determine whether this request is adjusting the revenue received from the buyer of the call. If set to "true" the value of adjustConverionByAmount must have the value by which you wish to adjust the revenue
adjustPayout Boolean value to determine whether this request is adjusting to payout amount paid to the publisher. If set to "true" the value of adjustPayoutByAmount must have the value by which you wish to adjust the payout
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
adjustConverionByAmount The amount by which you want to adjust the revenue received from the buyer. See the note below for further information
adjustPayoutByAmount The amount by which you want to adjust the payout amount paid to the publisher. See the note below for more information
__NOTE:__ This request will adjust the revenue/payout by a _relative_ amount, meaning that if the `adjustConverionByAmount` or `adjustPayoutByAmount` fields have a value of "0.10" it will add $0.10 to the total amount and if they have a value of "-0.10" it will subtract $0.10 from the total amount. To adjust these values _absolutely_ check out the "POST Adjust Revenue and/or Payment for a Call (with absolute adjusments)" request below.

response.name: Adjust Revenue and Payment for a Call (with relative adjustment)

body.raw:
{
    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": true,
    "adjustConverionByAmount": 0.01,
    "adjustPayoutByAmount": 0.01
}

response.name: Decrease Revenue and  Increase Payment for a Call (with relative adjustment)

body.raw:
{
    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": true,
    "adjustConverionByAmount": -0.01,
    "adjustPayoutByAmount": 0.01
}

response.name: Adjust Revenue Only for a Call (with relative adjustments)

    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": false,
    "adjustConverionByAmount": 0.01
}

    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": false,

item.name: Adjust Revenue and/or Payment for a Call (with absolute adjustments)

body.raw:
{
    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": true,
    "newConversionAmount": 0.10,
    "newPayoutAmount": 0.10
}

request.description:
This request can adjust the `revenue` received from a buyer for a call as well as the `payout` amount paid to a publisher for a call. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
reason The reason that the adjustment is being made
adjustConversion Boolean value to determine whether this request is adjusting the revenue received from the buyer of the call. If set to "true" the value of newConversionAmount must have the new value you want to set for the revenue
adjustPayout Boolean value to determine whether this request is adjusting to payout amount paid to the publisher. If set to "true" the value of newPayoutAmount must have the new value you want to set for the payout
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
newConversionAmount The new amount you want to set for the revenue received from the buyer. See the note below for further information
newPayoutAmount The new amount you want to set for the payout amount paid to the publisher. See the note below for more information
__NOTE:__ This request will adjust the revenue/payout by an _absolute_ amount, meaning that if the `newConversionAmount` or `newPayoutAmount` fields have a value of "0.10" it will change the total amount to $0.10. To adjust these values _relatively_ check out the "POST Adjust Revenue and/or Payment for a Call (with relative adjustments)" request above. __NOTE:__ The amounts for the adjustments cannot be negative number. If a request is sent with a negative value for either the `newConversionAmount` or `newPayoutAmount` fields you will receive an error with the message: "Conversion would be brought below zero, the max refund is $0.1".

response.name: Adjust Revenue and/or Payment for a Call (with absolute adjustments)

body.raw:
{
    "inboundCallId": "{{InboundCallId}}",
    "reason": "Call payments adjusted by acct. Admin.",
    "adjustConversion": true,
    "adjustPayout": true,
    "newConversionAmount": 0.10,
    "newPayoutAmount": 0.10
}

item.name: Void Revenue and/or Payment for a Call

request.description:
Request to void (subtract) an amount from the revenue and/or payout for a call. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
voidReason The reason that the void is being made
voidConversion Boolean value to determine whether this request is voiding some or all of the revenue received from the buyer of the call. If set to "true" the value of voidConverionAmount must have the amount you want to void from the revenue
voidPayout Boolean value to determine whether this request is voiding some or all of the payout amount paid to the publisher. If set to "true" the value of voidPayoutAmount must have the amount you want to void from the payout
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
voidConverionAmount The amount you want to void from the revenue received from the buyer. This value needs to be a positive number that is less than or equal to the current conversionAmount
voidPayoutAmount The amount you want to void from the payout amount paid to the publisher. This value needs to be a positive number that is less than or equal to the current payoutAmount

response.name: Void Revenue and Payment for a Call

request.description:
Request to add an annotation to a call to make it easier to find in the call log. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
tags An array containing an object for each of the tags you wish to add to the call. Each object in the array has the following required parameters:

tagType

This value should always be set to "Annotations"

tagName

The name you want to assign to the tag

tagValue

The value you want to assign to the tag

response.name: Add Annotation to a Call

item.name: BUYER Request for Payout Adjustment (with relative adjustment)

request.description:
Request to allow a buyer to send a request to the admin for the account handling the specified call to have the revenue amount adjusted. This request will send a notice to the admin of the account handling the campaign requesting an adjustment to the revenue for this call. The account admin will have final say in how much the actual adjustment is. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
reason The reason you are requesting the revenue amount be adjusted
amount The amount by which you want the revenue to be adjusted. This value can be positive or negative to reflect a request increase or decrease in the total payout. This amount is a relative change so if this field has a value 0f "0.20" the admin will receive a notice requesting the revenue be increased by $0.20

response.name: BUYER Request for Payout Adjustment (with relative adjustment)

item.name: BUYER Request for Payout Adjustment (with absolute adjustment)

request.description:
Request to allow a buyer to send a request to the admin for the account handling the specified call to have the revenue amount adjusted. This request will send a notice to the admin of the account handling the campaign requesting an adjustment to the revenue for this call. The account admin will have final say in how much the actual adjustment is. When the admin receives the requested adjustment, it will automatically be converted into a _relative_ adjustment to make the final amount equal to the _absolute_ amount specified in this request. #### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
inboundCallId The ID of the call you wish to make and adjustment for. You can get Call IDs using the Call Log Requests
reason The reason you are requesting the revenue amount be adjusted
amount The new amount you want as the revenue. This must be a positive number

response.name: BUYER Request for Payout Adjustment (with absolute adjustment)

item.description: Group of requests to modify the payout and revenue for specific calls.

item.name: Call Logs
Get Call Logs

request.description:
This request will show you all of the available columns that can be inculded in the Call Log. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) ### Response Overview

The body of the response to this request will contatain an array of objects. Each of the objects in this array is for one column available on the report and has some details to help you use them. If you want to include a column and/or sort by it, you will pull the `id` from the object for that column.

item.name: Get Tags for Filtering Call Log

request.description:
This request will allow you to view all tags available for filtering the call log by specific values. Tags are broken down by `Type` and each `Type` is broken down by `Name`. In order to filter by a tag you must include the `Type` `Name` and a `Value`.

The first example to the right shows a list of all of the tag `Types`. The subsequent examples to the right show the breakdown of the `Names` available for a few of the `Types`. To see how to implement these tags, check out the "Get Call Log With Filters" example to the right of the "POST Get Call Log" request below. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

response.name: Get Tag Names for Type: InboundNumbers
response.body:

request.description:
Request to get a log of the calls associated with this account. This log can be exported as a CSV using the "POST Export Call Log - CSV" request below to be more useful for human consumption. The call log must have a date range, which will return all calls within the date range and by default they will be sorted by "Call Date" in descending order. By default, all available columns will be displayed. Using the optional parameters will allow you to choose which columns are displayed, how the results are sorted, and filter by columns or available tags. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
reportStart Beginning of report time period in UTC format
reportEnd Beginning of report time period in UTC format
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
valueColumns Array of objects to select which columns are displayed. A list of available columns can be found by using the "GET Get Column Names" request above. See "Get Call Log With Specified Columns" example to the right for implementation.
orderByColumns Sorts the report in ascending or descending order by using asc or desc as the direction. Report can be sorted by multiple column and will prioritize them by their order in the array. So in the "Get Call Log Sorted" example to the right, the report will have all available columns displayed, sorted by numberId then if there are multiple rows with the same numberId, those columns will be sorted by callDt.
size The maximum number of calls you want to display on the report. The maximum size for reports is 1000. If you want a report with more than 100 calls, see the "POST Export Call Log-CSV" request below.
offset The number of calls you want to omit from the beginning of the report. So an offset value of 100 will make the report start with what would otherwise be call number 101.

* For more information on size/offset and how to create a paginated report, see the note below.
filters Array of filters to apply to the report. Within the array, filters are grouped into sub-arrays with the key of anyConditionToMatch and can be broken down by the following:

column

Filter by a value in any of the columns included in the call log or by a tag.

value

The value you want to filter based on

isNegativeMatch

Boolean value if set to "true" this will make the filter the opposite.

comparisonType

The type of comparison you want to apply to the value for the filter

See the notes below for more information about implementing filters.

__Note About Pagination:__ If you want to create a report with multiple pages, you can do that using the `size` and `offset` parameters. If you have a report with 1000 calls and want it broken into 10 pages with 100 calls each, you will need to make 10 requests with `size:100` and the following values for `offset`: * `offset:0` will return calls 1-100 * `offset:100` will return calls 101-200 * `offset:200` will return calls 201-300 Continue increasing the `offset` by 100 for each page until you have all 10 pages of the report. __Notes About Filters:__
The `comparisonType` has the following options: * "EQUALS" * "CONTAINS" * "BEGINS_WITH" * "GREATER_THAN" * "LESS_THAN" Each `comparisonType` can be negated by changing the `isNegativeMatch` value to "true". For example:
``` "column": "tag:Date:Day", "value": "1", "isNegativeMatch": false, "comparisonType": "EQUALS" ``` will return all calls with a day value equal to 1, while
``` "column": "tag:Date:Day", "value": "1", "isNegativeMatch": true, "comparisonType": "EQUALS" ``` will return calls from all other days of the month.

__Combining Filters:__
Filters can be combined as an __OR__ statement by putting them in the same `anyConditionToMatch` sub-array.
Filters can be combined as an __AND__ statement by putting them in separate `anyConditionToMatch` sub-arrays.
The "Get Call Log with Filters" example to the right shows how to filter for calls made on the 1st __OR__ 3rd day of the month __AND__ with a `hasConnected` value of "yes".

response.name: Get Call Log With Specified Columns

request.description:
Request to view more detail about specific calls using the `InboundCallId` which can be found using the "POST Get Call Log" request above. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
InboundCallId IDs of one or more calls

__NOTE:__ Even if the request body only contains one `InboundCallId` it must be in an array. If requesting details for more than one `InboundCallId` separate each Id with a comma.

item.description: These four requests can be used to create a call log to your desired specifications. Once the call log is created, the two requests in the next folder can be used to export it.

item.name: Export Call Logs

request.description:
Request to generate a CSV table for the call log. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
reportStart Beginning of report time period in UTC format
reportEnd Beginning of report time period in UTC format
valueColumns Columns desired on the report, at least one is required. The example to the right shows all columns available, but you only need to include the ones you want displayed on the report
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
orderByColumns Sorts the report in ascending or descending order by using `asc` or `desc` as the direction
__NOTE:__ The report can be sorted by multiple columns and will prioritize them by their order in the array. So in the following example, the report will have all available columns displayed, sorted by `numberId` then if there are multiple rows with the same `numberId`, those columns will be sorted by `callDt`. ### Response Overview

If successful, this request will return something like `"id": EJ772657c816e54f4face3c917f2a5f28c`. This `id` can then be used in the next request "GET Export CSV By Job Id" in order to retrieve the CSV file.

response.name: Export Call Log - CSV

request.description:
This request takes the `id` from the previous request in the place of {CSVJobId}. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Response Overview

This request will return an object with a "status". If the "status" is "Error" that means there is a problem with the CSV you attempted to generate in the previous request. If the "status" is "Pending" that means your report is not yet ready and you need to try again until the "status" changes to "Ready". Once you get a "status" of "Ready" the response will also have a "url". Copy this "url" and paste it into a browser window which will automatically initiate a download of a zip file. Download and unzip this file to see the CSV report you just generated.

response.name: Export By Job Id

item.description: Two requests needed to export a call log in a CSV format. The POST request generates the CSV and the GET request will return a url that can be used to download a zip file with the CSV of the call log.
#### Get logs of calls associated with account

item.name: Campaigns

request.description:
Request to get information about all active campaigns in your account. This request will not display information about any campaigns that you have deleted from your account. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

request.description:
Request to retrieve the stats for all campaigns associated with your account that have ever received calls, even if they have been deleted. Any active campaigns that have not yet received calls will not be displayed. To get stats for active campaigns without any calls, see the "GET Get Campaigns" request above and check out the optional query parameter `includeStats=true`. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

response.name: Get Campaigns Stats Only

item.name: Get Information About a Single Campaign

request.description:
Request to retrieve information about a campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
#### Optional Query Parameters `includeIntegrationSetting=true` After a ? in the url will add integration setting to the response if any are associated with the campaign. See the "Get Information About a Single Campaign with Integration Settings" example to the right for implementation.

__NOTE:__ The `campaignId` must have a capital "CA" at the beginning. If the "CA" is not capitalized you will receive an error message.

response.name: Get Information About a Single Campaign

item.name: Get Inbound References for a Single Campaign

request.description:
Request to retrieve a list of all the publishers, buyers, and targets that reference the specified campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

response.name: Get Inbound References for a Single Campaign

request.description:
Request to create a new campaign. If the request is sent using just the required parameters, the optional parameters will default to the values listed with each parameter. If you want to modify these default values later, you can do so with the "PATCH Update a Campaign" request below. In order to modify anything else, such as Targets, Default Number, Default Payouts, Offers, RTB settings, Publishers, Publisher Numbers, or Publisher Payout Overrides you will need to use the other requests in the "Campaigns" folder. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name of the campaign as it will be displayed in the Ringba portal. This is how publishers will identify the campaign.
countryCode The country you want the phone number for this campaign to be in.
#### Optional Parameters _Default values listed in italics below each parameter's decription_
Parameter Description
userCampaignId A custom ID that you will be able to use to track this campaign in reports.

Default: NONE
numberDisplayFormat The format you want the numbers for the campaign to be displayed by using an 'n' for each number. For example(nnn) nnn-nnnn will display as (212) 332-2345

Default: (nnn) nnn-nnnn
duplicateSettings An object to configure the criteria that will make a call from a number that has already called be counted as a duplicate. It has two parameters:

duplicateSetting

The criteria to make a call from a number that has already called count as a duplicate. This has three options:

  • "ON_CONNECT" will count any connected call form a repeat number
  • "ON_INCOMING" will count ant incoming call from a repeat number
  • "ON_CALL_LENGTH" will count any call that last longer than the number of seconds specified in the next parameter

    • Default: "ON_CONNECT"

callLengthInSeconds

Is using "ON_CONNECT" or "ON_INCOMING" set this value to 0.

If using "ON_CALL_LENGTH" this number specifies the number of seconds a call needs to last to be counted as a duplicate

Default: 0
deDupeSettings An object to specify what should be done with calls that are deemed to be a duplicate call. It has three parameters:

routeToOriginal

Boolean value. If set to true, duplicate calls will be routed to the target to which they were originally routed

Default: false

routeToDifferent

Boolean value. If set to true, duplicate calls will be routed to a different target than the one to which they were originally routed

Default: false

NOTE: If both of these are set to false, then calls will be routed normally according to the campaign's routing plan.

strict

Boolean value. If set to true, the rules established will be strictly adhered to even if the target is not accepting calls. If set to false, calls to targets not accepting calls will be automatically rerouted.

Default: true
dialSettings An object that has one parameter:

dialAttempts

The number of attempts to reach a target before routing to a different target

Default: 3
evalAnonymDuplication Boolean value. If set to true anonymous calls will be handled as duplicate calls.

Default: true
payoutDupesGlobal Boolean value. If set to true, only one payout will be allowed per Caller ID, regardless of what publisher generates the call.

Default: false
recordSetting An object to specify call recording settings for the campaign. It has three parameters:

record

Boolean value. If set to true, calls will be recorded for the campaign

Default: true

recordFromAnswer

Boolean value. If set to true, call recordings will start once the call is answered. If set to false the entire call will be recorded.

Default: true

trimSilence

Boolean value. If set to true, silence will be trimmed from the recording

Default: false

NOTE: If you set recordFromAnswer or trimSilence to true, you must also set record to true.

spamDetection An object that specifies how to handle potential spam calls. It has two parameters:

blockDuplicatesForSeconds

Automatically blocks calls with the same Caller ID for the specified number of seconds.

Default: 2

trackAnonymous

Boolean value. If set to true then anonymous calls (e.g.: +anonymous, +restricted, +unavailable, etc.) as the same Caller ID to be blocked for the specified number of seconds.

Default: false

response.name: Create New Campaign with all available parameters specified
Create New Campaign with name only and default values for optional parameters

request.description:
Request to update information about a campaign. __NOTE:__ This request will not modify any settings that are not explicitly stated. It also will not affect any of the other settings such as Targets, Default Number, Default Payouts, Offers, RTB settings, Publishers, Publisher Numbers, or Publisher Payout Overrides. To modify those settings you need to use the other requests found in the appropriate sub-folder of the "Campaigns" folder of this documentation ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

### Request Body

You can use this request to update any of the required or optional parameters specified in the description of the "POST Create New Campaign" request above.

item.name: Add a Default Number for a Campaign

request.description:
Request to add a default number to a campaign. This number will be used if your number pool is locked or if you do not a number pool for the campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
numberId The ID of the number you want to make the default number for the campaign. You can find IDs of numbers associated with your account associated with your account. The response returned from that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a id which is the ID needed for this request.

item.name: Add Publisher Number to a Campaign

request.description:
Request to add a publisher's number associated with your account to the specified campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

numberId The ID of the number you want to make the default number for the campaign. You can find IDs of numbers associated with your account. The response returned from that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a id which is the ID needed for this request.

item.name: Remove Default Number from a Campaign

request.description:
Request to remove a default number from a campaign ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
numberId The ID of the number you want to make the default number for the campaign. You can find IDs of numbers associated with your account using the "GET Get Numbers Associated with Your Account" request found in the "Numbers" folder above. The response returned from that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a id which is the ID needed for this request.

request.description:
Request to add a publisher to a campaign. This only adds them to the campaign but does not add any numbers or payout overrides for the publisher. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
publisherId The ID of the publisher you want to add to the campaign. Find publishers associated with your account.

item.name: Number Js Tags
Get Js Tags for a Number

request.description:
Request to get Js Tags associated with a specified number. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account `numberId` get IDs of [numbers](#get-numbers-associated-with-your-account) associated with your account. The response returned form that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a `id` which is the ID needed for this request.

response.name: Get Js Tags for a Number

item.name: Create New Js Tag for a Number

request.description:
Request to create a new Js Tag for the specified number ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account `numberId` get IDs of [numbers](#get-numbers-associated-with-your-account) associated with your account. The response returned form that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a `id` which is the ID needed for this request. ### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name you want to assign to this Js Tag
e164ExistingNumber The number that you will be displaying on your webpage that you want to link to the campaign number specified in the request.
hasNumberPool Boolean value to determine if this Js Tag is linking to a number pool. Set to false if you are linking it to a single number
numberPoolId If hasNumberPool is set to true, put the ID of the number pool here

response.name: Create New Js Tag for a Number

The response returned form that request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a `id` which is the ID needed for this request.

response.name: Remove a Js Tag from a Number

item.description: These requests will help you to get, create, or delete a Js tag from a campaign. Js tags allow you to inject JavaScript into your webpage to connect a number on your webpage to the specified campaign.

item.name: Add Target Route to a Campaign

request.description:
Request to add a target to a campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
targetId The ID of target you want to add to the campaign
priority An object with two parameters:

priority

The priority you want to assign to the target. This is used to select targets, with 1 being the highest priority.

weight

The weight assigned to a target in case there are two targets with the same priority. __NOTE:__ The weight is a _relative_ value so if two targets with the same priority each have a weight of 10, they will each receive 50% of calls. If one has a weight of 5 and one has a weight of 10 then the one with a weight of 5 will receive twice the amount of calls as the one with a weight of 10.
callConversion An object with multiple options. See the Conversion Options section below for more information.
#### Conversion Options If you want the call to convert on any dialed call, use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "dialed"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when this target is dialed
If you want the call to convert on any connected call, use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "connectedCall"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when this target is dialed
If you want the call to convert based on a postback or webhook use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "postBack"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when this target is dialed
__NOTE:__ If you elect to convert based on a webhook or postback, you will need to set up the endpoint for the webhook using the requests in the "Webhooks" section of this documentation
If you want the call to convert based on call length use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "callLength"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when this target is dialed
conversionArgs An object with the following parameters:

startTimerEvent

The event which will trigger the timer to measure call length. This has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall"
  • "OnDial"
  • "OnConnectedCall"

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds after the timer has been triggered until the call will convert

Check out the "Add Target converting on call length" example to see how to add a target that converts 30 seconds after a call has connected.

item.name: Add Target Group Route to a Campaign

request.description:
Request to add a target group to a campaign.
### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
targetGroupId The ID of target group you want to add to the campaign
priority An object with two parameters:

priority

The priority you want to assign to the target group. This is used to select target groups, with 1 being the highest priority.

weight

The weight assigned to a target group in case there are two targets with the same priority. __NOTE:__ The weight is a _relative_ value so if two targets with the same priority each have a weight of 10, they will each receive 50% of calls. If one has a weight of 5 and one has a weight of 10 then the one with a weight of 5 will receive twice the amount of calls as the one with a weight of 10.
callConversion An object with multiple options. See the Target Group Conversion Options section below for more information.
#### Target Group Conversion Options If you want the call to convert on any dialed call, use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "dialed"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when this target group is dialed
If you want the call to convert on any connected call, use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "connectedCall"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when a target in this target group has a call connect
If you want the call to convert based on a postback or webhook use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "postBack"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when the webhook or postback endpoint is reached
__NOTE:__ If you elect to convert based on a webhook or postback, you will need to set up the endpoint for the webhook using the requests in the "Webhooks" section of this documentation
If you want the call to convert based on call length use the following parameters in the `callConversion` object:
Parameter Description
conversionType Set value to "callLength"
conversionValue The amount of money generated when the call length is satisfied
conversionArgs An object with the following parameters:

startTimerEvent

The event which will trigger the timer to measure call length. This has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall"
  • "OnDial"
  • "OnConnectedCall"

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds after the timer has been triggered until the call will convert

Check out the "Add Target Group converting on call length" example to see how to add a target group that converts 30 seconds after a call has connected.

item.name: Remove Target Route from a Campaign

request.description:
Request to remove a target or a target group from a campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
id The campaign route ID
__NOTE:__ This is _not_ the target/target group ID. It is the ID for the route on the campaign. You can retrieve this ID using the "GET Get Information About a Single Campaign" request above. Each route will have an ID beginning with "CR", this is the campaign route ID.

item.name: Invite Publisher to Participate in Offer

request.description:
Request to invite a publisher to join the published offer associated with the specified campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
publisherId The ID of the publisher you want to invite to participate in the published offer for the specified campaign. Get IDs of publishers associated with your account.
message The message you want the publisher to see when they receive the invite for the offer.

response.name: Invite Publisher to Participate in Offer

item.name: Create a Draft Offer for a Campaign

body.raw:
{
    "numberRestrictions": {
        "allowTF": true,
        "allowDID": true,
        "maxNumbersPerPublisher": 1
    },
    "offerVisibility": "private",
    "languageCodes": [
        "EN"
    ],
    "requireApproval": false,
    "name": "New Offer",
    "description": "This is an offer to be sent to publishers",
    "notes": "These notes can only be seen in the detail view",
    "category": "Home Services\\Tree Removal",
    "expiration": "03/10/2021 03:48 PM",
    "timeZoneId": "Mountain Standard Time"
}

request.description:
Request to create a draft offer for a campaign. Once successful, this draft will be stored in your account until it is published or deleted. If you want to edit the draft before publishing, resend this request with the updated information. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name you want to assign to this offer
description A description for the offer that will be shown when it is sent to the publishers
category The industry category that the offer pertains to i.e. "Automotive\\Car Insurance" for an offer that will be sent to buyers in the car insurance industry
offerVisibility

Determines who can see the offer. This has two options:

  • "private" makes the offer invitation-only
  • "account" makes the offer visible to any of your registered publishers
requireApproval Boolean value. If set to true then publishers must be approved by you before they can participate in an offer.
languageCodes An array containing the codes for the languages of callers that should be routed through this offer
numberRestrictions An object with the following parameters:

allowTF

Boolean value to determine if publishers can allocate Toll-Free numbers to this offer. This is the default setting that can be overridden per publisher.

allowDID

Boolean value to determine if publishers can allocate Toll-Free numbers to this offer. This is the default setting that can be overridden per publisher.

NOTE: At least one of the allowTF or allowDID must be set to true

maxNumbersPerPublisher

The maximum number of unique publisher numbers a participating publisher can allocate to this offer. This is the default setting that can be overridden per publisher.

#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
notes Additional information about the offer that will only be visible when the publisher views the detail view for the offer
expiration The offer will be discontinued at the specified date and time. It will no longer accept calls or new participants. It can be re-enabled after it expires. Publishers will be notified about the expiration immediately when they receive the offers and upon expiration. If you set an expiation you also need to add the following parameter called timeZoneId
timeZoneId The time zone that the expiration is set in

response.name: Delete Published Offer for a Campaign when no published offers are present
Delete Published Offer for a Campaign

item.description:
A group of requests that allow you to create and manage offers to publishers. An Offer is a convenient way to present the campaign to your publishers. It is a public representation of the campaign that allows publishers to quickly decide whether they want to send calls to a campaign and whether their calls meet the requirements.

__NOTE:__ You can have multiple draft offers at any time, but only one published offer per campaign.

item.name: Add New Default Payout for a Campaign

request.description:
Request to add a new default payout setting for a campaign. This default payout will be applied to all publishers associated with the campaign unless an override for a publisher is set up using the "Publisher Payout Overrides" requests. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

There are two types of default payouts you can use for a campaign: 1. "Fixed Amount" will modify the payout to a specific amount based on the parameters provided. For more information see the [Fixed Amount](#fixed-amount-payout) Section below. 2. "Revenue Share" will modify the payout to a percentage of what the payout would otherwise be based on the parameters provided. For more information see the [Revenue Share](#revenue-share-payout) Section below. ##### Fixed Amount Payout
#### Fixed Amount Required Parameters
Parameter Description
isRevShare Set this value to false.
priority

The order in which default payouts will be prioritized if a call meets the criteria of more than one.

NOTE: if this is the first default payout you are setting up for the campaign, set the priority to "0", which is the highest priority. If you already have default payout(s) associated with this campaign, make sure you each one has a different priority.
payoutAmount The fixed amount that will be paid for calls meeting the criteria of the default payout
payoutConversionType

The event that will trigger a payout to the publisher. This has four options:

  • "connectedCall" will trigger on any call that connects
  • "incomingCall" will trigger on any incoming call.
  • "convertedCall" will trigger on any call that converts
  • "callLength" will convert based on the length of the call.

NOTE: if using the "callLength" option, the payoutConversionArgs parameter is also required. See the Payout Conversion Args below for more information.
#### Fixed Amount Payout Conversion Args This parameter is required only if you are using a `payoutConversionType` of "callLength".
Parameter Description
payoutConversionArgs An object that contains the following parameters:

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds that a call needs to last in order to convert

startTimerEvent

The event that will start the clock for the call length. This has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall" Starts the call as soon as it arrives at Ringba before any RTB or routing has been applied
  • "OnDial" Starts the timer once Ringba dials a target (and before the target answers)
  • "OnCallConnected" Starts the timer once a call is answered by the target
##### Revenue Share Payout
#### RevShare Required Parameters
Parameter Description
isRevShare Set this value to true.
priority

The order in which default payouts will be prioritized if a call meets the criteria of more than one.

NOTE: if this is the first default payout you are setting up for the campaign, set the priority to "0", which is the highest priority. If you already have default payout(s) associated with this campaign, make sure you each one has a different priority.
revSharePercentage The percent amount of the standard payout that you want to pay for calls in this campaign
#### RevShare Optional Parameters If you are using the Revenue Share Payout option, you can also add a minimum and maximum payout amount using the following parameters.
Parameter Description
revShareMinPayoutAmount The minimum payment for calls to this campaign. If the revSharePercentage would otherwise make the payment lower than this amount, it will be adjusted to this amount.
revShareMaxPayoutAmount The maximum payment for calls to this campaign. If the revSharePercentage would otherwise make the payment higher than this amount, it will be adjusted to this amount.
#### Optional Parameters (Fixed Amount OR RevShare) Ã
Parameter Description
deDupeSetting Determines how payouts will be handled for duplicate or repeat calls. This is an object containing one parameter

secondsFromLasCall

Has three options:

  • -1 disables payouts for duplicate calls
  • 0 enables payouts for all duplicate calls
  • any value greater than 0 allows payouts for duplicate calls that are separated by that number of seconds
allTimeCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the campaign. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
monthlyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the campaign each month. Once a new month starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
dailyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the campaign each day. Once a new day starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
hourlyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the campaign each hour. Once a new hour starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
concurrencyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of concurrent calls is reached. Once a call is completed, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
allTimeSumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount. A value of "-1" will disable this limit. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
monthlySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount each month. Once a new month starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
dailySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount each day. Once a new day starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
hourlySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount each day. Once a new hour starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
payoutHours sets the hours during which payouts will be credited for calls to this campaign. This parameter is an array of 7 objects, one for each day starting with Sunday. Each day object contains the following parameters:

openTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) payouts will start being credited

closeTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) payouts will start being credited

inverted

Set this value to "false"

isClosed

If set to "true" this will disable payouts for the campaign for the entire day, regardless of the values for openTime or closeTime.

NOTE: See the "Add New Default Payout With All Optional Parameters Specified" example to the right to see how to set the hours of operation to Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM and closed Saturday and Sunday.
timeZoneId The time zone for the payoutHours limits for the campaign
sendNotifications Boolean value. If set to true all publishers associated with the campaign will receive a notification about the new default payout settings being added.

item.name: Update ALL Default Payout Settings for a Campaign

request.description:
Request to modify __ALL__ default payout settings for a specified campaign. __NOTE:__ This request will modify all of the default payouts for the campaign, so if a default payout is not included in the request body it will be removed from the campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
### Request Body

The best way to ensure the fidelity of all the payouts associated with the campaign, it is recommended that you follow these steps in order to use this request: 1. Using the "GET Get Information About a Single Campaign" request above, you can retrieve the most current settings for the campaign's default payouts. See the example associated with that request and check out the `defaultPayouts` array, starting on line 27. 3. Once you run that request for the campaign you are interested in, take the objects (one for each default payout) in the `defaultPayouts` array and paste them into an array called `allPayouts` in the body of this request. 3. The `allPayouts` array needs to be put into a JSON object in the body of this request. See the example for implementation 4. At this point, you can modify any of the settings for any or all of the default payouts for the campaign. Check out the "POST Add New Default Payout" request above for an explanation of each setting and which ones are required for a Fixed or a RevShare Payout. __NOTE:__ For this request, the `sendNotifications` parameter is specified one time outside of the `allPayouts` array to determine if publishers will be notified about the changes made using this request. Following these steps will be the best way to use this request and ensure that none of the default payouts are lost by not being included in the request body.

request.description:
Request to modify a __single__ default payout setting for a campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`payoutId` IDs of default payout settings for a campaign can be found in the `defaultPayouts` object in the response of the "GET Get Information About a Single Campaign" request above. ### Request Body

This request can be used to modify any of the settings for a default payout. Check out the "POST Add New Default Payout for a Campaign" request above for an explanation of all the parameters for a default payout. You can include as many of the parameters as you would like but make sure you at least have the following parameters: `isRevShare` must be included even if it is not being changed If true, you must include `revSharePercentage` even if it is not being changed If false, you must include `payoutAmount` and `payoutConversionType` even if they are not being changed

response.name: Update Single Default Payout Settings with only one change
Update Single Default Payout Settings

item.name: Remove Default Payout Setting form a Campaign

request.description:
Request to remove a default payout setting from a campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`payoutId` IDs of default payout settings for a campaign can be found in the `defaultPayouts` object in the response of the "GET Get Information About a Single Campaign" request above.

response.name: Remove Default Payout Setting form a Campaign

request.description:
Request to view the payout overrides for a publisher associated with a specific campaign. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account ### Response Overview The response will show you what overrides exist for the publisher and campaign you specify in the request. Any field with a value of "-1" means that there is no override set for the publisher and that the campaign payout settings apply for that setting.

Request to create a new payout override for a specified publisher. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account ### Request Body

There are two types of payout override you can use for a publisher: 1. "Fixed Amount" will modify the payout to a specific amount based on the parameters provided. For more information see the [Fixed Amount](#fixed-amount-publisher-override) Section below. 2. "Revenue Share" will modify the payout to a percentage of what the payout would otherwise be based on the parameters provided. For more information see the [Revenue Share](#revenue-share-publisher-override) Section below. ##### Fixed Amount Publisher Override
#### Fixed Amount Required Parameters
Parameter Description
isRevShare Set this value to false.
priority

The order in which default payouts will be prioritized if a call meets the criteria of more than one.

NOTE: if this is the first payout override you are setting up for the publisher, set the priority to "0", which is the highest priority. If you already have payout override(s) associated with this publisher, make sure you each one has a different priority.
payoutAmount The fixed amount that will be paid for calls meeting the criteria of the payout override
payoutConversionType

The event that will trigger a payout to the publisher. This has four options:

  • "connectedCall" will trigger on any call that connects
  • "incomingCall" will trigger on any incoming call.
  • "convertedCall" will trigger on any call that converts
  • "callLength" will convert based on the length of the call.

NOTE: if using the "callLength" option, the payoutConversionArgs parameter is also required. See the Payout Conversion Args below for more information.
#### Fixed Amount Payout Conversion Args This parameter is required only if you are using a `payoutConversionType` of "callLength".
Parameter Description
payoutConversionArgs An object that contains the following parameters:

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds that a call needs to last in order to convert

startTimerEvent

The event that will start the clock for the call length. This has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall" Starts the call as soon as it arrives at Ringba before any RTB or routing has been applied
  • "OnDial" Starts the timer once Ringba dials a target (and before the target answers)
  • "OnCallConnected" Starts the timer once a call is answered by the target
##### Revenue Share Publisher Override
#### RevShare Required Parameters
Parameter Description
isRevShare Set this value to true.
priority

The order in which payout overrides will be prioritized if a call meets the criteria of more than one.

NOTE: if this is the first payout override you are setting up for the publisher, set the priority to "0", which is the highest priority. If you already have payout override(s) associated with this publisher, make sure you each one has a different priority.
revSharePercentage The percent amount of the standard payout that you want to pay for calls to this publisher in this campaign
#### RevShare Optional Parameters If you are using the Revenue Share Payout option, you can also add a minimum and maximum payout amount using the following parameters.
Parameter Description
revShareMinPayoutAmount The minimum payment for calls to this publisher though this campaign. If the revSharePercentage would otherwise make the payment lower than this amount, it will be adjusted to this amount.
revShareMaxPayoutAmount The maximum payment for calls to this publisher through this campaign. If the revSharePercentage would otherwise make the payment higher than this amount, it will be adjusted to this amount.
#### Optional Parameters (Fixed Amount OR RevShare) Ã
Parameter Description
deDupeSetting Determines how payouts will be handled for duplicate or repeat calls. This is an object containing one parameter

secondsFromLasCall

Has three options:

  • -1 disables payouts for duplicate calls
  • 0 enables payouts for all duplicate calls
  • any value greater than 0 allows payouts for duplicate calls that are separated by that number of seconds
allTimeCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the publisher. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
monthlyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the publisher each month. Once a new month starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
dailyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the publisher each day. Once a new day starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
hourlyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of calls is reached for the publisher each hour. Once a new hour starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
concurrencyCap Payouts will be credited until this number of concurrent calls is reached for this publisher. Once a call is completed, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
allTimeSumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount for this publisher. A value of "-1" will disable this limit. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
monthlySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount for this publisher each month. Once a new month starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
dailySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount for this publisher each day. Once a new day starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
hourlySumCap Payouts will continue to be credited until the payouts reach this dollar amount for this publisher each day. Once a new hour starts, payouts will continue to accrue. A value of "-1" will disable this limit.
payoutHours sets the hours during which payouts will be credited for calls to this publisher. This parameter is an array of 7 objects, one for each day starting with Sunday. Each day object contains the following parameters:

openTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) payouts will start being credited

closeTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) payouts will start being credited

inverted

Set this value to "false"

isClosed

If set to "true" this will disable payouts for the publisher for the entire day, regardless of the values for openTime or closeTime.

NOTE: See the "Add New Publisher Payout Override With All Optional Parameters Specified" example to the right to see how to set the hours of operation to Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM and closed Saturday and Sunday.
timeZoneId The time zone for the payoutHours limits for the campaign
sendNotifications Boolean value. If set to true the publishers associated with the override will receive a notification about the new default payout settings being added.

response.name: Create New Publisher Payout Override

request.description:
Request to modify __all__ publisher payout overrides. This request will modify all payout overrides for the specified publisher, so if an override is not included in the request body, it will be removed. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account ### Request Body

The best way to ensure the fidelity of all the payouts associated with the campaign, it is recommended that you follow these steps in order to use this request: 1. Using the "GET Get Publisher Payout Overrides" request above, you can retrieve the most current settings for the publisher's payout overrides. See the example associated with that request and check out the `payoutSettings` array, starting on line 3. 3. Once you run that request for the campaign you are interested in, take the objects (one for each default payout) in the `payoutSettings` array and paste them into an array called `allPayouts` in the body of this request. 3. The `allPayouts` array needs to be put into a JSON object in the body of this request. See the example for implementation 4. At this point, you can modify any of the settings for any or all of the default payouts for the campaign. Check out the "POST Create New Publisher Payout Override" request above for an explanation of each setting and which ones are required for a Fixed or a RevShare Payout. __NOTE:__ For this request, the `sendNotifications` parameter is specified one time outside of the `allPayouts` array to determine if publisher will be notified about the changes made using this request. Following these steps will be the best way to use this request and ensure that none of the payout overrides are lost by not being included in the request body.

response.name: Update ALL Publisher Payout Overrides

request.description:
Request to modify a __single__ payout override from the specified publisher. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account `payoutId` can be found using the "GET Get Publisher Payout Overrides" request above. ### Request Body

This request can be used to modify any of the settings for a publisher payout override. Check out the "POST Add New Publisher Payout Override" request above for an explanation of all the parameters for a publisher payout override. You can include as many of the parameters as you would like but make sure you at least have the following parameters: `isRevShare` must be included even if it is not being changed If true, you must include `revSharePercentage` even if it is not being changed If false, you must include `payoutAmount` and `payoutConversionType` even if they are not being changed

response.name: Update Single Publisher Payout Override
