request.description:
Request to remove a payout override from the specified publisher. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
\####`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#?????) associated with your account `payoutId` can be found using the "GET Get Publisher Payout Overrides" request above.

response.name: Remove a Publisher Payout Override

request.description:
Request to get details about the real time bidding settings for a campaign. If RTB is not enabled for the campaign, you will see an error message like the one in the "Get RTB for Campaign without RTB enabled" example. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

response.name: Get RTB for Campaign with RTB enabled
Get RTB for Campaign without RTB enabled

request.description:
Request to enable RTB for a campaign __for the first time__ and to establish the RTB settings for that campaign. If you want to modify the RTB settings for a campaign that has previously had RTB enabled, use the "PATCH Edit RTB Settings for a Campaign" request below.
### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
enabled Boolean value, set to "true" to enable RTB for the campaign
sipOnly Boolean value. If set to true, this will make it so that RTB for this campaign will only provide SIP URI numbers to be called
callerIdRequired Boolean value. If set to true, a caller ID is required for every ping and any ping without a caller ID will be ignored.
icp Stands for Instant Caller Profiles and has the following options:

"Off"

Disables ICP for the campaign RTB

"On"

Enables ICP for the campaign RTB. If enabled, ICP will be used to enrich the call for every ping that contains a caller ID.

"Required"

If set to "Required", no bid will be returned if the call didn't trigger ICP.
bidExpirationPolicy An object to specify when bids expire and how to handle expired bids. It has the following parameters:

bidExpirationInSeconds

The number of seconds that a bid will remain valid after its creation.

routeCallsForStaleBids

Determines the behavior of bids after the bidExpirationInSeconds is reached. If set to "false" then calls will be rejected after they expire. If set to "true" then calls will be routed normally regardless of whether or not they have expired.
rateLimit An object to set a limit to the number of RTB bids for the campaign. It has the following parameters:

maxRequests

The maximum number of requests in a specified time period. To specify the time period see the options for the next parameter perSeconds

perSeconds

Specifies the time period for the maxRequests parameter. There are three options for the time period:

  • "60" to specify maxRequests per minute
  • "3600" to specify maxRequests per hour
  • "86400" to specify maxRequests per day
bidSettings An object to specify the settings for RTB bids for the campaign. It has the following parameters:

baseBidAmount

The dollar value of a bid before any adjustments are made

maxBidAmount

The maximum dollar value for a bid regardless of adjustments made

conversionType

Determines what event will convert a call and has the following options:

  • "incomingCall" converts any incoming call
  • "connectedCall" converts any connected call
  • "callLength" converts a call based on length. If using this option, you need to include the conversionArgs parameter within the bidSettings object. See the ConversionArgs Table below for more details

deDupeSetting

This determines if/when duplicate or repeat calls will be paid multiple times. It has three options:

  • "-1" will allow payouts for repeat calls regardless of how much time passes between calls
  • "0" disables payouts for repeat calls
  • "3600" enables payouts for repeat calls as long as they are more than one hour (3600 seconds) apart. Any multiple of 3600 can be entered for this value.
#### ConversionArgs Table If you use the `callLength` option for `conversionType` you must include the following object in the `bidSettings` object:
Parameter Description
conversionArgs An objects that specifies how long a call needs to last in order to convert. It has the following parameters:

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds that a call needs to last in order to convert

startTimerEvent

The event that will start the timer for the call length. It has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall" Starts the call as soon as it arrives at Ringba before any RTB or routing has been applied
  • "OnDial" Starts the timer once Ringba dials a target (and before the target answers)
  • "OnCallConnected" Starts the timer once a call is answered by the target
#### Optional Parameters ##### Bid Adjustments You can add bid adjustments based on tags by adding a parameter called `bidAdjustments`, which is an array that contains an object for each adjustment. Each adjustment object contains the following parameters:
Parameter Description
criteria An object the specifies the criteria that bids should be compared to for filtering. It has the following parameters:

tagId

The name of the tag you want to compare a bid to

comparisonType

Specifies the criteria that a tag must meet to trigger the bid modifier. This has the following value options:

  • "EQUALS"
  • "CONTAINS"
  • "GREATER_THAN"
  • "LESS_THAN"
  • "BULK"
  • "MATCH"
  • "REGEX"
  • "REQUIRED"

See the comparisonType Table below for more information.

value

The value you want to use for the comparison

isNegativeMatch

Boolean value. If set to "true" then the comparison type is negated so "EQUALS" would become "NOT EQUAL TO" and "GREATER_THAN" would become "LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO"
adjustmentType The type of adjustment to be made if the bid modifier is triggered. You can make the following adjustments to a bid:

"Add"

Adds a value to the bid, specified by the adjustmentValue parameter below. Adding a negative number will subtract that amount from the payout.

"Multiply"

Multiplies the bid by the amount specified by the adjustmentValue parameter below.

"Override"

Overrides the bid amount, changing it to the amount specified by the adjustmentValue parameter below.

"Reject"

Causes the bid to be rejected if the modifier is triggered. If using "Reject" the adjustmentValue parameter needs to have a value of "0".
adjustmentValue The amount by which you want to adjust the bid if the modifier is triggered.
#### comparisonType Table
Option Description
"EQUALS" Triggers if bids have a tag specified in the tagId equal to the value specified in the criteria object.
"CONTAINS" Triggers if bids have a tag specified in the tagId containing the value specified in the criteria object.
"GREATER_THAN" Triggers if bids have a tag specified in the tagId greater than the value specified in the criteria object.
"LESS_THAN" Triggers if bids have a tag specified in the tagId less than the value specified in the criteria object.
"BULK" Allows a user to set adjustments for multiple cases in one modifier. For example, if you want different adjustments based on age, you can do that with a bulk modifier. For more details, see the Bulk Modifiers section below or the "Add Bulk Modifier to a Campaign" example associated with the "PATCH Edit RTB Settings for a Campaign" request for implementation.
"MATCH" Can be used for two cases:

To trigger in cases where the tag specified in tagId is NOT SET use a comparisonType of "MATCH", a value of "?*", and set isNegativeMatch to true.

See the tag with a tagId of "tag four" in the "Enable RTB for a Campaign with adjustments" example for implementation.

To trigger based on a Wildcard Match. For example:

If you have a tag for the full name but only want calls with a surname of "Smith" you can use a comparisonType of "MATCH" and a value of "*Smith*"

See the tag with a tagId of "full name" in the "Enable RTB for a Campaign with adjustments" example for implementation.

"REGEX"

Triggers if bids have a tag specified in the tagId that contains a regular expression specified in the value specified in the criteria object.

For example if you want to modify bids from any IP address starting with 201 you can specify a tagId for IP address and a value of 201\.\d{1,3}\.\d{1,3}\.\d{1,3}

For more information about the RegEx used by Ringba click here.
"REQUIRED" Rejects any bid that does not have the tag specified in the tagId in the criteria object.

NOTE: If using the "REQUIRED" comparisonType the value needs to be a blank string (""). The adjustmentType and adjustmentValue fields can be omitted.
#### Bulk Modifiers If you want to add a bulk modifier to specify different adjustment based on different values for one criteria, the first step is to create a CSV file to specify the adjustment criteria. If you wanted to adjust bids based on age, you could make a table like the following and download it as a CSV file:
16 2.00
17 2.00
18 2.00
19 2.00
20 2.00
21 1.50
22 1.50
23 1.50
24 1.50
25 1.50
26 1.50
27 1.50
28 1.50
29 1.50
30 1.00
__NOTE:__ The first column in this table represents the age and in this case the second column represents the factor by which the bid will be multiplied because it uses an `adjustmentType` of "Multiply" (see below). You can use any of the available `adjustmentTypes` and the values in the second column will be the `adjustmentValue` for that criteria. Once you have downloaded the table as a CSV file, use the "PUT Create RTB Bulk Modifier from CSV" request in the "RTB Bulk Modifiers" folder to upload the CSV file. This request will return and object called `rtbBulkModifierList` that will have an `id` starting with "RTBLIST..." which you will need for the next step. Once you have the `id` create an object like the following: ``` { "criteria": { "tagId": "Age Bulk Modifier", "comparisonType": "BULK", "value": "1", "isNegativeMatch": false }, "adjustmentType": "Multiply", "adjustmentValue": 1.0, "bulkListId": "RTBLISTc5de66696f8142448b0f0de930c35acb" } ``` and add it to the `bidAdjustments` array. See the tag labelled "Age Bulk Modifier" in the "Enable RTB for a Campaign with adjustments" example for implementation. __NOTE:__ The `bulkListId` is required if you are adding a bulk modifier.

response.name: Enable RTB for a Campaign
Enable RTB for a Campaign with adjustments

item.name: Edit RTB Settings for a Campaign

request.description:
Request to modify RTB setting for a campaign that has RTB enabled. See the "PUT Enable RTB for a Campaign for an explanation of what each parameter does. Any parameter can be modified using this request. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

response.name: Add Bulk Modifier to a Campaign
Pause RTB for a Campaign

request.description:
Request to disable RTB for a campaign. This request will remove all RTB settings so after it is sent successfully, you will need to use the "PUT Enable RTB for a Campaign" request in order to reactivate RTB for the campaign. __NOTE:__ If you just want to pause RTB for the campaign without losing your previously established RTB settings, you can use the "PATCH Edit RTB Settings for a Campaign" request. See the "Pause RTB for a Campaign" example associated with that request. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)

response.name: Disable RTB for a Campaign

Request to get the publisher's URLs for the requests in the "Real Time Bidding (RTB) folder. ### Path Variables

item.name: Override RTB Settings for a Publisher

request.description:
Request to override the campaign's RTB settings for a specific publisher ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`campaignId` get IDs of your [campaigns](#get-campaign-information)
`publisherId` get IDs of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account ### Request Body

#### Required Parameters You can override the campaign's RTB settings using the following parameters:
Parameter Description
enabled Boolean value. If set to false, RTB will be disabled for this publisher
callerIdRequiredOverride Boolean value. If set to true, a Caller ID is required for calls to this publisher.
rateLimitOverride An object to override the campaign's limit to the number of RTB bids for the publisher. It has the following parameters:

maxRequests

The maximum number of requests in a specified time period. To specify the time period see the options for the next parameter perSeconds

perSeconds

Specifies the time period for the maxRequests parameter. There are three options for the time period:

  • "60" to specify maxRequests per minute
  • "3600" to specify maxRequests per hour
  • "86400" to specify maxRequests per day
bidSettingsOverride An object to override the campaign's settings for RTB bids for the publisher. It has the following parameters:

baseBidAmount

The dollar value of a bid before any adjustments are made

maxBidAmount

The maximum dollar value for a bid regardless of adjustments made

conversionType

Determines what event will convert a call and has the following options:

  • "incomingCall" converts any incoming call
  • "connectedCall" converts any connected call
  • "callLength" converts a call based on length. If using this option, you need to include the conversionArgs parameter within the bidSettingsOverride object. See the ConversionArgs Table below for more details

deDupeSetting

This determines if/when duplicate or repeat calls will be paid multiple times. It has three options:

  • "-1" will allow payouts for repeat calls regardless of how much time passes between calls
  • "0" disables payouts for repeat calls
  • "3600" enables payouts for repeat calls as long as they are more than one hour (3600 seconds) apart. Any multiple of 3600 can be entered for this value.
bidAdjustmentsOverride Used to override the campaign's bid adjustment settings. For more information about bid adjustments check out the Bid Adjustments section of the "PUT Enable RTB for a Campaign" request.
#### ConversionArgs Override Table If you use the `callLength` option for `conversionType` you must include the following object in the `bidSettings` object:
Parameter Description
conversionArgs An objects that specifies how long a call needs to last in order to convert. It has the following parameters:

callLengthInSeconds

The number of seconds that a call needs to last in order to convert

startTimerEvent

The event that will start the timer for the call length. It has three options:

  • "OnIncomingCall" Starts the call as soon as it arrives at Ringba before any RTB or routing has been applied
  • "OnDial" Starts the timer once Ringba dials a target (and before the target answers)
  • "OnCallConnected" Starts the timer once a call is answered by the target

item.name: Publishers

Each object in the array contains a parameter called `id` which is the `publisherID` that is used in other requests in this documentation. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

item.name: Get User Details for a Publisher

request.description:
Request to get details about the users associated with a specific publisher. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account.

response.name: Get User Details for a Publisher

item.name: Get Inbound References for a Publisher

request.description:
Request to get all references to a specific publisher. This will show you all campaigns, phone numbers, and users associated with the publisher. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account.

response.name: Get Inbound References for a Publisher

request.description:
Request to create a new publisher. In order to give users access to the publisher, you will need to use the "POST Invite a User to Join a Publisher" request in the "Publisher Invitations" folder below. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name of the publisher
createNumbers Boolean value. If set to true, the publisher will be able to create new numbers. If false, the publisher will only be able to get numbers already associated with your account.
doNotCreateUser Set this value to true
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
subId A subId to be used to tracking the publisher
blockCallsIfCapped Boolean value. If set to true, calls will be blocked to this publisher once the publisher's payout cap has been reached. If this parameter is null or not included in the request, then your account settings will be applied for this setting.
accessToRecordings Boolean value. If set to true, the publisher will have access to call recordings in the report. If this parameter is null or not included in the request, then your account settings will be applied for this setting.

response.name: Create New Publisher
response.body:
{
    "transactionId": "TR4537e9a7-8868-4981-a03e-b6f3d63ba072",
    "publishers": {
        "id": "AFad1ada6acc6e43a68f18c31ec54bef19",
        "subId": "pubSubId",
        "createNumbers": true,
        "accessToRecordings": true,
        "isSelf": false,
        "blockCallsIfCapped": false,
        "name": "New Publisher",
        "accountId": "RA25107ee2411049989cd8672852278bdb",
        "enabled": true,
        "version": 1
    }
}

request.description:
Request to modify details for a publisher. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account. ### Request Body

This request can be used to modify any of the settings described in the Request Body section of the "POST Create New Publisher" request above.

        "accessToRecordings": false,
        "isSelf": false,
        "name": "New Name",
        "accountId": "RA25107ee2411049989cd8672852278bdb",
        "enabled": true,
        "version": 1
    }
}

query.description: If set to true, pulisher will be deleted even if it has active inbound references
If set to true, numbers associated with the publisher will stay in your account. If set to false, hte numbers will be deallocated.

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account.

response.name: Delete a Publisher

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account.

response.name: Get Invitations for a Publisher

request.description:
Request to view details about a single invitation to join a publisher. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account.
`invitationId` Find IDs of invitations to join a publisher using the "GET Get Invitations for a Publisher" request above

request.description:
Request to invite a Ringba user to join a publisher associated with your account. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`publisherId` Find a list of [publishers](#get-information-about-publishers) associated with your account. ### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
email The email address of the Ringba user you want to send the invitation to.
confirmEmail This must match the value of email
firstName The first name of the Ringba user you are inviting to join the publisher.
lastName The last name of the Ringba user you are inviting to join the publisher.

request.description:
Request to allocate a new number for use with your account. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Paramter Description
countryCode The code for the country in which you want to purchase a phone number
chargeAccountIfNeeded Boolean value. If set to true, your default credit card will be billed if your account balance is not sufficient to complete the transaction. If set to false the request will fail if your account balance is not sufficient to complete the transaction.
isTollFree

US numbers only

 Boolean value. Determines whether this number will be a toll-free number.
#### Optional Parameters
Paramter Description
areaCode

US numbers only

 The three digit prefix that you want for this number. Must be a valid US area code. If you are creating a toll-free number, you can only use valid toll-free prefixes for this value (800, 888, 877, 866, 855, 844, 833).

NOTE: To add an 800 number, you need to contact your sales account manager.

NOTE: If you are getting an error message of "could not allocate new number from telco provider" (See the "Create New Number failed due to lack of inventory" example) you can try allocating a number without specifying the prefix. If you want the prefix that you are trying to specify, you must contact you sales account manager.

request.description:

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberId` Find your [numberIds](#get-numbers-associated-with-your-account). The response returned from the "GET Get Numbers Associated With Your Account" request will contain an object for each number. Parameter Description
enabled Boolean value. If se to false, calls to the number will be paused but the number will remain associated with your account.
name The name of the number to make it easier to find in reports
tags An object containing two parameters.

tagValue

item.name: Delete a Number From Your Account

request.description:
Request to delete a specific number from your account. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberId` Find your [numberIds](#get-numbers-associated-with-your-account). The response returned from the "GET Get Numbers Associated With Your Account" request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a id which is the ID needed for this request.

__NOTE:__ If the number you are attempting to delete is linked to other objects (publishers, campaigns, etc.) this request will fail (see the "Delete a Number From Your Account (failed because number is linked to other objects)" example). One way to solve this is to manually unlink the number from anything it is linked to. Another option is to use the following optional query parameter: `?unlink=true` See the "Delete a Number From Your Account with unlink query parameter" example.

response.name: Delete a Number From Your Account (failed request- trying to delete a number that was already deleted)
Delete a Number From Your Account with unlink query parameter
Delete a Number From Your Account
Delete a Number From Your Account (failed because number is linked to other objects)

item.name: Remove a Publisher from a Number

request.description:
Request to remove a publisher from a number associated with your account. ### Path Variables

`accountId` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberId` Find your [numberIds](#get-numbers-associated-with-your-account). The response returned from the "GET Get Numbers Associated With Your Account" request will contain an object for each number. Each number object will have a id which is the ID needed for this request. `publisherID` The ID of the publisher that is currently assigned to the specified number. You can see what publisher is assigned to the number using the "GET Get Details About a Specific Number" request above. The response from that request will have an object called `affiliate` which will contain an `id` which is the ID of the publisher associated with the number.

request.description:
Request to create a new number pool. This request only creates the number pool. In order to add numbers to the pool, once it is created you will need to use the "PUT Allocate More Numbers to a Number Pool" request below. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name you want to assign to the number pool
assignmentSettings

An object containing required and optional parameters.

NOTE: isTollFree and areaCode only apply if the countryCode is set to "US".

countryCode (required)

The code for the country you want to purchase numbers in.

isTollFree (required- US only)

Boolean value. If set to true, all numbers in the pool will be toll-free, which come with a higher per-minute charges. If set to false, local numbers will be used.

areaCode (optional- US only)

If desired, you can set a specific area code for the numbers in your new number pool.

chargeAccountIfNeeded

Boolean value. If set to true, your credit card will be charged to allocate new numbers to the pool if your account balance is insufficient. If set to false, allocation will fail if your account balance is not sufficient. Recommended to set the value to true.
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
holdNumberOutOfPoolInSeconds The length of time (in seconds) that Ringba locks a number to a user after they close their browser window.
totalTimeForNumberOutOfPoolInSeconds The length of time (in seconds) that Ringba locks a number to a user if they leave their browser window open and idle.

response.name: Create New Number Pool

item.name: Replace Numbers In a Number Pool

request.description:
Request to replace numbers in a pool. With this request, you cannot specify the numbers being replaced, just how many will be replaced with new numbers. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberPoolId` Find IDs of your [number pools](#get-information-about-number-pools)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
count The number of phone numbers you want to release and replace in the number pool

response.name: Replace Numbers In a Number Pool

item.name: Decrease Size of a Number Pool

request.description:
Request to shrink the size of the number pool by releasing numbers from it. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberPoolId` Find IDs of your [number pools](#get-information-about-number-pools)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
count The number of phone numbers you want to release from the number pool
keepNumbers Boolean value. If set to true, numbers released from the number pool will still be kept in your account. If set to false the numbers will be removed from the number pool and from your account.

response.name: Decrease Size of a Number Pool

item.name: Allocate More Numbers to a Number Pool

request.description:
Request to allocate numbers to a number pool. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberPoolId` Find IDs of your [number pools](#get-information-about-number-pools)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
allocation The number of phone numbers you want to add to the number pool
chargeAccountIfNeeded Boolean value. If set to true, your credit card will be charged for number allocation if your account balance is not sufficient. If set to false, allocation will fail if account balance is not sufficient. Recommended to be set to true.

item.name: Increase Size of a Number Pool

request.description:
Request to increase the size of a number pool. This is the same request as the "PUT Allocate More Numbers to a Number Pool" request above. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `numberPoolId` Find IDs of your [number pools](#get-information-about-number-pools)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
allocation The number of phone numbers you want to add to the number pool
chargeAccountIfNeeded Boolean value. If set to true, your credit card will be charged for number allocation if your account balance is not sufficient. If set to false, allocation will fail if account balance is not sufficient. Recommended to be set to true.

request.description:
Request to block a phone number, phone numbers with a certain prefix, or calls from anonymous callers. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
phoneNumber The number you want to block. To block anonymous calls, give this a value of "+anonymous". To block an area code, for example area code +1(555) give this a value of "+1555*". To block a specific phone number, for example +1(555)666-1234, give this a value of "+15556661234".
campaignId Specifies the campaign for which you want to block the number. If you want to block it across all campaigns, leave empty quotes for the value, otherwise give this a value of the desired campaign's ID.
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
expInHour The number of hours you want to block call from this number. If this parameter is not included in the request, the number will be blocked indefinitely.

request.description:
Request to edit the settings for a blocked number. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information) `blockedNumberId` The ID of the blocked number you want details for. You can find the IDs of all blocked numbers associated with your account using the "GET Get Blocked Phone Numbers" request above.

### Request Body

This request can be used to modify the `phoneNumber` or `campaignId` which are explained in the description of the "POST Block a Phone Number" request above. Additionally, you can include the following parameters in the request body:
Parameter Description
timeLimited Boolean value. If set to false the number will be blocked indefinitely
expiration Use this to adjust when the blocked number will no longer be blocked
__NOTE:__ If you are adding an expiration to a blocked number that was previously blocked indefinitely, you must include both of these parameters.

item.name: Real Time Bidding (RTB)

request.description:
### Path Variables <hr>

`environment` For more information about environments see the [Selecting Your Environment](#selecting-your-environment) section above

`rtbId` For more information about rtb ID see the [Configuring your RTB ID](#configuring-your-rtb-id) section above

### Request Details <hr>

This example request uses only the **CID** and **sipOk** tags, but bid requests can contain an unlimited combination of optional or required tags. If required tags are missing no bid will be returned. 

`CID` - The Caller ID associated with the inbound call. 

`sipOk` - If the request contains "sipOk=yes", a SIP address will be returned instead of a DID.

To see what tags are required on your campaign please see the request examples provided inside of your Ringba account. 

1. **For Admins:** Go to the campaign page and click on the documentation icon for the publisher you want to view.

2. **For Publishers:** Go to the campaign page, click the RTB tab, and then click the RTB documentation button.

response.name: GET JSON with CID and SipOk

        <Warning code="222">Request executed in Sandbox mode. The bid amount is NOT guaranteed to be equal to production mode bid, and the phone number and/or SIP address cannot be used to forward your call. This is the best way to send test requests.</Warning>

item.description:
Ringba's RTB technology was built specifically to facilitate programmatic call trading between buyers and sellers. This API gives buyers the ability to bid on live phone calls in real-time. ### Getting Started
Ringba's flexible architecture allows for the passing of unlimited dynamic data points along with bid requests in a single transaction via GET or a POST using JSON or XML. ### Selecting Your Environment
The `Environment` variable can have one of 3 different values:
Environment Value Description
Production This environment is used for live bidding
Test This environment is for testing your RTB integration. Please note that the Test environment has a restrictive rate limit, non-routable numbers, and may result in billable costs if TCPA Shield, Instant Caller Profiles, or other incremental service is enabled on the campaign
Sandbox Similar to the Test environment, but only returns sample data as opposed to live campaign data
### Configuring your RTB ID
The `rtbI` is a unique identifier that is assigned to every publisher inside an RTB-enabled campaign. Publishers will have a different `rtbId` for every campaign. To view the `rtbId` follow these steps in the portal: __For Publishers:__ Under the "Campaigns" tab, click "Manage Campaigns". Click on the name of a campaign that has an "RTB Status" of "ON". This will bring up the details for the campaign selected. At the top of the page under the campaign title, click the "Real Time Bidding" tab, which will display the RTB setting for the campaign. At the top of the details, there is field called "RTB Id" which contains your `rtbId` for use in the following requests. __For Admin Users:__ Under the "Campaigns" tab, click "Manage Campaigns". Click on the name of a campaign that has an "RTB Status" of "ON". This will bring up the details for the campaign selected. Scroll down to the "Publishers" section of the page. Under the name of each publisher you will see an "RTB ID" and the value that follows is the `rtbId` for use in the following requests. ### Bid Explanation
Bids are in US dollars, rounded to two decimal places. For example, $33.10 is reflected in the bid amount as 33.10. If a call is received to a SIP address after the bid expiration has elapsed, the call will be rejected. If the call is received to a DID after the bid expiration the call may be rejected or may still connect, however, no value will be credited to the publisher. Please ensure that calls are forwarded and connected before the bid expires. ### Response Overview

#### Bid Field Definitions
Field Definition
bidId Bid's unique ID
bidAmount Payout for the publisher if the bidTerms are accomplished
expireInSeconds After this period of time, the bid will expire and may not be honored
bidExpireDT The exact Date and Time when the bid expires
bidExpireEpoch The epoch of the expiration time
phoneNumber The Phone Number to route the phone call to
sipAddress The SIP Address to route the phone call to
bidTerms The specific conditions that must be accomplished in order to the publisher be paid. See the Bid Terms Codes table below for more details
warnings Important notifications about this bid request. See the following Warning Codes table for more details
#### Warning Codes
Warning Code Description
200 The bid cannot be guaranteed without a caller ID. Calls may be routed differently based on the information about the caller. Provided Caller ID will not be disclosed to the account administrator unless they win the bid and the call is connected.
205 Sending calls via SIP is preferred over routing them to DID. DID numbers are not unique and are not protected from receiving spam calls or calls from expired bids. Consider always providing Caller ID when not using SIP.
220 Request executed in Test mode. The bid amount is guaranteed to be equal to a production mode bid, but the phone number and/or SIP address cannot be used to forward your call. Requests to this endpoint are heavily throttled, if you need to do significant testing use Sandbox mode instead.
222 Request executed in Sandbox mode. The bid amount is not guaranteed to be equal to a production mode bid, and the phone number and/or SIP address cannot be used to forward your call. This is the best way to send test requests.

#### Bid Terms Codes The `bidTerms` response object contains the specific conditions and requirements that a buyer needs to be met in order for the publisher to be paid for the call. Here is a full list of bidding codes
Bid Terms Code Description
100 Minimum call duration in seconds
101 Call must connect
102 Call must convert
110 Duplicate calls are not allowed

request.description:
Request to create a new target. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)

### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name of your new target to make it easy to identify later
schedule An object containing the following parameters:

timeZoneId

The only required parameter for the schedule object and contains the time zone for the target

* See the Schedule Table below for more information about other parameters that can be included in the schedule object.
instructions

An object containing additional parameters. There are two options for the instructions depending if the target is going to be a phone number or SIP URI.

* See the two tables below for more information about the instructions object
If using a phone number the instructions object has the following parameters:
callType Has a value of "number"
number The phone number of the target you are creating
connectionTimeout The number of seconds to wait before re-routing to another target if this target does not answer
If using a SIP URI the instructions object has the following parameters:
callType Has a value of "sip"
connectionTimeout The number of seconds to wait before re-routing to another target if this target does not answer
sip Is an object containing the following parameters:

number

The address for the SIP URI

userName

The user name used to access your SIP URI

password

The password used to access your SIP URI
__NOTE:__ See the examples to the right called "Create Target With Phone Number" and "Create Target With SIP URI" to the right to compare the differences in the ``instructions`` field. #### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
subId ID for tracking this target
owner object containing the id of the Buyer you want this target assigned to. Find a list of buyerIds
blockRecordings Boolean value for whether or not the target is blocked from recording calls
targetCallIncrement Determines at what point a call to this target will count toward the target's capacity limits. The parameter has three options:
  • "onConnect" will count any call that connected
  • "onConvert" will count any call that is converted based on the buyer's specifications
  • "onRevenue" will count any call that leads to revenue for the buyer
##### Target Schedule Table
Parameter Description
hoursOfOperation sets the hours of operation for the target. This parameter is an array of 7 objects, one for each day starting with Sunday. Each day object contains the following parameters:

openTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) the target opens for business

closeTime

Object with parameters hour and minute to decide what hours (in 24 hour format) the target closes for business

inverted

Set this value to "false"

isClosed

If set to "true" this will set the target to "closed" for the entire day, regardless of the values for openTime or closeTime.

NOTE: See the "Create New Target With Hours of Operation" example to the right to see how to set the hours of operation to Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM and closed Saturday and Sunday.
allTimeCap Limits the total number of calls that will be routed to this target
monthlyCap Limits the number of calls routed to this target per month
dailyCap Limits the number of calls routed to this target per day
hourlyCap Limits the number of call routed to this target per hour
concurrencyCap Limits the number of simultaneous live calls for this target
callConcurrencyMatrix An array containing 7 sub-arrays, one for each day of the week starting with Sunday. Each sub-array contains 24 values, one for each hour starting with 12am. Each value determines the concurrencyCap for that day and hour. See the "Create New Target With Concurrency Matrix" example to the right to see how to limit the capacity to 2 calls Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM while leaving all other times unlimited.
__NOTE:__ To make an unlimited cap for any of these parameters, use a value of "-1".
__NOTE:__ See the example to the right called "Create Target With All Available Parameters" to see how to write a request using all required and optional parameters.

request.description:

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body
The body of this request needs to have the entire object for the target you are interested in. Use the [GET Get Targets](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-targets) request above to view a list of all the targets associated with your account. Find the target you are interested in within the "targets" array in the response and copy it into the body of this request. See the examples to see how the request body should be formatted.

Request to view all the campaigns that the target group is assigned to and the targets assigned to the target group. ### Path Variables

response.name: Get Inbound References for Specific Target Group

request.description:
Request to create a new target group. This request will only create the target group, in order to assign targets to the group see the "PATCH Add Single Target to Target Group" or "PATCH Add/Remove Multiple Targets to/from Target Group" requests below. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body
#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name The name of the target group to display on reports
schedule An object containing the following parameters:

timeZoneId

The only required parameter for the schedule object and contains the time zone for the target group.
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
isSimalDial Boolean value, if set to "true" then a call to this target group will simultaneously dial all targets in the group and the first to answer will get the call
disableTargets Boolean value that if set to "true" will disable the targets within the target group from receiving calls
enabled Boolean value that if set to false will disable the entire target group from receiving calls
In addition to these optional parameters, a target group can override certain settings for the targets in the group using the following parameters:
Parameter Description
oCapacity Overrides the call capacity settings for the target
oConcurrency Overrides the concurrency settings for the target
oSchedule Overrides the hours of operation for the target
Each of the above is an object with the following three parameters, which are all boolean values and only one should be set to true.
Parameter Description
campaignOverride Overrides the settings for the targets in the group only within the context of the campaign using the target group
globalOverride Overrides the settings for the targets in the group everywhere not just within the campaing using the target group
waterfallOverride This feature is being deprecated and should be set to "false"
__NOTE:__ If any of the override parameters is set to true, they must be specified in the ``schedule`` parameter. For details on how to write the additional schedule parameters, see the "POST Create New Target" request in the "Targets" section above.

request.description:
Request to edit the information about a target group. In the example to the right the only thing that was changed was the ``name`` using the request body. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
``targetGroupId`` Find a list of [targetGroupIds](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-target-groups)
### Request Body

See the "POST Create Target Group" request above for an explanation of available parameters. Any of the required or optional parameters can be modified using this request. ### Response Overview

The response to this request will include an complete overview of the target group including the targets within the group and stats for the group.

response.name: Edit Target Group
response.body:
{

request.description:
Request to reset counts for a specific target groups. This will reset all counts to zero. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
``targetGroupId`` Find a list of [targetGroupIds](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-target-groups)
### Response Overview

The response to this request will return the stats for the target group and for each target within the target group. They will be separated as an object for each based on the ``targetId`` or ``targetGroupId``

response.name: Reset Counts for Target Group

item.name: Delete Single Target from Target Group

request.description:
Request to delete a single target from a target group. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
``targetGroupId`` Find a list of [targetGroupIds](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-target-groups)
``targetId`` Find a list of [targetIds](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-targets) ### Response Overview

The response to this request has a field `targets` which will display all remaining targets in the target group.

request.description:
Request to delete a target group from your account. This request will only work if the target group has no targets assigned to it. If you need to remove targets from the target group, see the "DELETE Delete Single Target from Target Group" or the "PATCH Add/Remove Multiple Targets to/from Target Group" requests above. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
``targetGroupId`` Find a list of [targetGroupIds](#get-and-edit-information-about-your-target-groups)

request.description:
Create a new webhook for use with your account. ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
### Request Body

#### Required Parameters
Parameter Description
name This is the name that will be used to describe your webhook information on the report
incomingCallIdQueryStringParameter This is the name of the variable that Ringba will collect the call Id from, we use the call Id to identify which call the requests refer to
conversionAmountQueryStringParameter Name of the variable that Ringba will collect the revenue from
#### Optional Parameters
Parameter Description
conversionCriteriaParameterMatch If the optional string is set and the incoming request has it on the parameters then Ringba will set the call as converted and add revenue to the call.

response.name: Create New Webhook

request.description:
Remove a webhook from your account ### Path Variables

``accountId`` Find your [accountId](#get-your-account-information)
`webHookId` Find IDs of your webhooks using the "GET Get Webhooks" request above

response.name: Delete a Webhook

item.description:
A Webhook is used to get information into Ringba from outside the platform. Webhooks are endpoints that allow you to send data back to Ringba for performance based routing and enhanced reporting. After generating a webhook, you can pass Ringba back data using the Call Token assigned to every call.

__NOTE:__ To set up a webhook, you must be an Account Administrator.
